text:
SEEMA AZIZ: So we didn't
grow big in a day.

We had first the one store,
then the second, fourth.

We have people with us
working for nearly all the--

who've been with us for the 31
years that we've been around,

and many who have been there
for more than 25 or 26 years.

So I feel that a culture
gets created over time.
It's a way of life.
You can't lecture people on it.

So I guess the new
people who come in

just come into this culture of
where we absolutely will not

tolerate the wrong thing
being sold to the customer.

So it's a policy we made
right from the beginning.

If something's wrong
with the embroidery,
a little sticker goes on there.

Because very often, customers
cannot see the difference,

or they will not
be able to tell.

And so a sticker goes
on, and every salesman

knows that they have to tell
the customer that this is
the slight flaw in this fabric.
You have to buy it knowing that.

So I think it's something which,
through practice, has become--

everybody knows that this
is the way we want to work.
